titleStmt.title: James Boyd et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5410

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Lewis County Ky understanding that an effort is being made to obtain a pardon for Wm Fuller who was convicted at the last term of the Lewis Circuit Court for the Malicious & wilful injury & destruction of the property of George Rea and fined fifty dollars beg leave earnestly to remonstrate against the same. It was a very aggravated case. It was submitted to the Judge without a Jury and fully and fairly tried and he was convicted and a motion for a new trial after an elaborate agrument was overruled The testimony conduced to show that Fuller was one of an organized band who has been who has engaged in many acts of lawlessness and violence in this County and this is the first opportunity of bringing one to Justice. His conviction has had a salutary influence in favor of law & order in the County and the undersignned do hope that the Govenor will not counteract that influence by pardoning him.

James Boyd
Nesbitt Taylor Senr.
Seth Parker
W. A. Thomson
E. H. Parkes
John T Henderson
G. W. Jordan
Alvin M Wallingford
Roe Jordan
Wm T. Hughs
